items.catalyzed_reaction: NADPH-dependent reduction of aldehydes and ketones to alcohols; oxidation of alcohols to aldehydes/ketones. Prefers sterically demanding (bulky) aromatic and cyclic substrates. Example: reduction of 2-hydroxypropiophenone, benzaldehyde, cyclohexanone; oxidation of cyclohexanol.
items.formulation: Purified enzyme, stored in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol L−1, pH 7.5) at −20°C, or lyophilized and stored at −20°C. For stability studies, 50% (v/v) glycerol in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol L−1, pH 7.5) at −20°C. Enzyme also used in solution for assays.
items.molecular_weight_unit: kDa (monomer); native MW by SEC: 75 kDa (suggesting trimer)
items.name: Alcohol dehydrogenase from Ralstonia sp. (RADH)
items.origin_organism: Ralstonia sp. DSM 6428 (also known as Cupriavidus sp.)
items.production_organism: Escherichia coli BL21(DE3) (recombinant expression, vector pET-22b(+))
items.purity_specification: Purity of about 90% according to SDS–PAGE (Supplementary Information, Fig. S4A).
